description: From Middle English fely, felow, felowe, felwe, felȝe, from Old English felġe, dative of felg, from Proto-Germanic *felgō (compare Saterland Frisian feelge, Dutch velg, German Felge), from Proto-Indo-European *pl̥ǵʰ- (compare Polish płoza (“sliding iron”), Old Church Slavonic пльзати (plĭzati, “to creep, crawl”)).

entries.meaning: The outer rim of a wheel, supported by the spokes.

description: From Middle English felly, felli, fellich, equivalent to fell +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: felly (comparative more felly, superlative most felly)
